Installing Apps from outside Snap Store (using .deb file for example) works like a charm and the applications have access to all files systems.

When installing the same apps from Snap Store it have the problem of only accessing the main partition with the OS is installed, other partitions are inaccessible!!

Very painful. Not Recommended.
summary: Installed App does not have access to Partitions

description:
Installed from terminal via snapd in Linux Mint Cinnamon. It didn't place an icon in the menu, I have to run Snap Store from the terminal. Doesn't respect or follow my system theme. The front page has a lot of blank space, while the search bar and some of the categories are collapsed by default. Also, a couple apps show two star ratings, when they have nothing but one-star reviews.
Canonical, do you want to maybe try again?
summary: Shoddy, incomplete, no integration with Cinnamon

description: One Great App Store for every Linux Distribution

Hello,

The app doesn't open when I click to open it, help please.

some said snap store is abundant for unbuntu users.

i think not. the snap shore is better than cli tools becos it include more attactive grafx and screen shots (of course for gui version) plus the reviews.

also a few more generic comments on snap (cli and gui)

- too many test snaps (shall be tidy up)
- requirement no clear, in particular those require wine. shall explicitly specify the apps require extra vm, e.g. kde framework, wine, etc, as it will add up the total size and make small app not worth to d/l/
- better to include reviews for both cli and gui (i.e. snapd and snap store)

summary: Intrersting. ClamTk found a lot of stuff to consider

description:
Users should not be forced to write something about a snap application when they want to rate it. There should be a possibility for the user to rate without any other comments, just like Google Play. A user can say "OK, I want to rate it 4 stars", but after that, not saying that "Oh! Writing a comment? So I prefer not to rate". You may loose some points here.

Bookmarking would be also a good feature here. I may want to mark an application to install it later. There is no such possibility there.

Download-only feature is also unavailable via the graphical interface. Adding this feature, there should be also the possibility of installing offline (i.e. already-downloaded) snaps with security considerations.

Although it's one of the best out there for linux, still would like to focus on details (like download progress, download section, launch button, download speed, option to add app icon to desktop etc )

I am using Ubuntu 17.10 in 2019(because of wayland for Odroid XU4) and it cannot use apt. So, I changed its repository but it has some risks. But, Snap contains all libraries in its package and Snap Store only provides Snap Packages. This made my Odroid to install software safe.

description: Installed from terminal via snapd in Mint Cinnamon. There are no icons, there are false revews, and the thing crashes every three minutes. Also when I open it, it says "unable to connect to server" worthless.

The concept is great but the execution is not such a great experience. 

I installed FreeMind and discovered that the permissions defined in Snap Store for FreeMind does not allow me to use removable media such as a USB stick or other partition.
This made me with my inexperience do things with AppArmor which resulted in a huge system-wide mess.

All applications on Snap Store must provide greater customisation around permissions to warrant the time and money spent on developing this.
summary: 2 days on Ubuntu and this resulted in a complete mess

solucionen el problema de que solo anda si cambio a idioma ingles mi sistema. lo necesito en español. asi calificare con 5 estrellas, por ahora 1 sola
Jejeje, instalen la versión 41.3-63 esa si funciona mejor, no reconoce actualizado algunos programas pero funciona.

Si van a instalar Software de Ubuntu, asegúrense que es el de la barra superior marrón, no el de la barra superior gris claro que es la copia que instala la tienda Snap.

No dejen malos comentarios en la aplicación Software ya que perjudica a la aplicación buena, dejen sus comentarios negativos en Snap Store, de esa forma se hace justicia. Yo he eliminado mi comentario negativo de Software cuando me he dado cuenta de la realidad y lo estoy poniendo en esta porquería de aplicación.

La "COPIA" (la de la barra superior gris claro) que ha instalado Ubuntu siempre ha sido pésima, pero últimamente "malfunciona" peor.

No aparece el software instalado, o mejor dicho, aparece cuando le da la gana.

Siempre se bloquea, se traba, es LENTO.

Lo único que tiene de bueno es que es gráfico, en comparación al Synaptic.

Por último, sin internet no funciona.

Si les interesa que algún día la gente tome en serio el software libre, deberían empezar por mejorar el gestor de software de Snap, por otro lado piden donaciones para estos pésimos proyectos.
summary: Instalen Gnome Software, este que Snap instala es una copia
